Key Match Events: Amen Thompson and Terry Rozier were suspended for their roles in a skirmish during the final moments of the Rockets-Heat game on December 30, 2024.
Houston coach Ime Udoka was fined $50,000 for verbally abusing a game official and not leaving the court in a timely manner.
Jalen Green was fined $35,000 and Tyler Herro was fined $25,000 for their roles in the fight.
Fred VanVleet was fined $35,000 for making contact with referee Marc Davis.
Seven ejections occurred in the final minute of the game, including VanVleet, Thompson, Rozier, Udoka, Houston assistant coach Ben Sullivan, Green, and Herro.
Miami won the game 104-100 after a late 19-5 run.
Post-Match Reflections: Tyler Herro led all scorers with 27 points, nine assists, and six rebounds.
Herro commented on the frustration of Amen Thompson, attributing it to his own performance.
Herro mentioned that the Rockets lost control of their feelings as the game turned in Miami's favor.
Herro expects to play in the next game despite a bruise near his hip from the fall.
